label: Description
value: Short curtain panel printed in a multicolored design of a detached floral pattern showing chinoiserie influence. In body of the curtain, a wide border of pavilions, boats, people in Chinese dress. Border is printed in one piece with the curtain. In shades of red, blue, violet, yellow and green (blue over yellow).

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave, glazed

label: Description
value: Short curtain or border of yellow cotton with detached conventionalized motif in body of curtain. Border of classic revival design. Enlaced bands form medallions to frame a hippocamp. Color are dark red, black and green (probably blue over yellow). Lined with terra cotta-colored muslin.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed using padded ground, glazed
Elevation View of a Locomotive, First Prize Drawing

label: Description
value: Side elevation of a locomotive facing right.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor and gouache, pen and black ink on off-white wove paper

label: Description
value: Vertical panel with series of borders around a central field containing serpentine flowering sprays with small birds, arabesque spandrels in corner and arabesque medallion in center, both with flower-filled compartments. Wide inner border of big decorated flower heads in scrolling stems and leaves. Wide outer border with continuous row of tri-lobed forms on cusped bases with flower fillings, scrolling floral guard borders. In red, dark purple, blue, gold on undyed cotton ground. Red and blue remain most strongly. Faced with plain blue cloth around edges; backed with minute floral sprig repeat on undyed cotton. Close-set irregular diamond and diagonal quilting or following lines of the design. In blue and white silk, white cotton.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed and painted on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mary E. Dreier from the estate of Katherine S. Dreier

label: Description

label: Provenance
value: Katherine S. Dreier; 1953: acquired by Museum          [1] Acquired by Katherine Dreier directly from Alicia Whistler's daughter, Emma Palmer

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: Crimson satin ground with a symmetrical repeat of large attenuated floral ogives in greens, pale blue, mauve, light orange, yellow, and beige. Smaller symmetrical bouquets in interstices. Motifs woven first in crimson plain weave on the satin ground; then above colors introduced in certain areas.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound satin weave with supplementary weft

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mary E. Dreier from the estate of Katherine S. Dreier

label: Description
value: Oblong cover of cream-colored linen embroidred in colored silks and gold thread. Trimmed with a narrow silver lace edge. Corner designs of conventionalized flower sprays with rose or carnation as main flower. Center design of four similar flower sprays springing in cruciform arrangement from center, where a bird with spread wings and crest is seen in profile. If peacock, possibly a symbol of immortality. Border of conventionalized vine, small flowers and strawberries. Pattern arrangement and type of flowers suggest piece was made for liturgical use.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk, metallic thread (gold on silk core) Technique: satin, knot and couching stitch embroidery

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mary E. Dreier from the estate of Katherine S. Dreier
Sarah Bernhardt as the Duke of Reichstadt (later King of Rome)

value: Full-length vertical format portrait of the actress turned toward the left. She is dressed in a military uniform and holds a whip behind her back.

label: Physical description

label: Description
value: Incomplete repeat of a twisting floral and leaf design, green, yellow, and black, on a brown patterned ground.

label: Provenance
value: Found at Barclay's Bank, 7 Manor Street, Bridlington, the former residence of Sir Henry Boynton, who in 1825 converted two houses, built about 1790, into one. This paper was applied before the remodelling.

label: Notes
value: Flowering plants and branches rise against a pale pink sky from a ground having conventionalized vegetation; flowers are white, red, purple, and orange.

label: Description
value: Panel of cotton printed in dark brown and red, probably a combination of copper plate and block printing.  Red appears to be added over dark brown.  Scenes from the death and burial of Lord Nelson with inscriptions.  Both selvages are present in which there are three blue threads.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: copperplate and block-printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 158 x 68 cm (5 ft. 2 3/16 in. x 26 3/4 in.) Repeat H: 55.2 cm (21 3/4 in.)

value: Panel of cotton printed in dark brown and red, probably a combination of copper plate and block printing. Red appears to be added over dark brown. Scenes from the death and burial of Lord Nelson with inscriptions. Both selvages are present in which there are three blue threads.

label: Description
value: Standing girl facing left, leaning on the arm of an upoholstered chair.

label: Description
value:
Young girl is seated in a bentwood caned chair in front of a table. She appears to be either sewing or embroidering.

From Catalogue Card: Vertical rectangle. A young girl is seated near a table. Her head is seen in profile, facing right, and bent forward over her sewing. Dated lower left: "Sept. 8th 1883." Inscription by artist, originally framed with drawing, now on mount: "Marian making a birthday present for her mamma / M. H. F. / Point lookout / Sept. 8th '83."

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on heavy cream wove paper

label: Description
value:
View of a house with Dutch door (top portion is shown open) through a grove of trees. 
From Catalogue Card: Horizontal rectangle. View of the exterior of a Colonial type house, seen through the trees. The entrance has a portico and a dutch doorway, partially open.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream heavy wove paper

label: Description
value: The Woolworth Building is shown at left, reaching almost the upper limits of the plate. The Singer Building is seen just beyond it.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Achilles H. Kohn

label: Description
value: Wide border, probably from a coverlet, with an offset repeat of bouquets of flowers tied with a bow, and with tiny delicate flower sprays between the larger bouquets. Top and bottom guard borders are set off by fine curving lines, with fanciful symmetrical flower sprays alternating wtih delicate arabesque and floral arrangements with diaper filling. Very fine silk chain stitch in intense shades of black, blue, green, gold, red, pink, and white, on a fine off-white plain twill cotton ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery, cotton foundation Technique: chain stitch embroidery on 2\2 twill foundation

label: Description
value: Fragment of silk brocade with an orange ground with a minute tulip pattern forming a diaper in the background. The main, symmetrical floral pattern is brocaded in pale shades of blue, green, red, white, and gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp patterning and discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Medium-scale symmetrical stylized floral repeats in horizontal rows. Each framing hexagonal field formed by horizontal zigzag band between each row of flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 113 x 50 cm (44 1/2 x 19 11/16 in.)

label: Dimensions

value: Large scale pattern of serpentine of fantastic flowers rising from rocaille forms, in white on a green ground.

label: Description
value: Child's cap of white linen. The broad brim is pierced and embroidered in a small all-over floral design in white, primarily in buttonhole stitch. The crown of the cap is of fine cotton dimity, shirred into extremely fine pleats. Bound with plain braid. At lower corners, inside, two loops of twisted thread indicate place for ties.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen Technique: whitework embroidery with deflected element work Label: linen embroidered in linen with openwork, cotton crown

label: Description
value: Interior of a theater, looking toward the series of boxes to the left of the stage. Rows of orchestra seats are shown, as well as a section of the pit. Several women are seated in the boxes; two men are seated in the orchestra, one standing, talking to a lady in one of the boxes.
